You can frost the cake once it has cooled, but if you want to frost it later (or make the frosting ahead of time), you can store it in the refrigerator in a bowl with plastic wrap applied directly on top of the frosting. Make sure it is covered completely, and it will last in the fridge for a couple days.

input_text: I have ground cumin, ground cayenne pepper, water, clove garlic, lime juice, paprika, chickpeas, olive oil, tahini. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Simple Spicy Hummus with 1 (15 ounce) can chickpeas (garbanzo beans), drained, 1/4 cup olive oil, 1/4 cup lime juice, 2 tablespoons tahini, or more to taste, 1 clove garlic, peeled, 1 tablespoon water, or as needed (optional), 1 teaspoon paprika, 1 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper, 1/4 teaspoon ground cumin. Here's the instruction: Place chickpeas in a blender; top with olive oil, lime juice, tahini, and garlic. Blend mixture until smooth. Add water 1 tablespoon at a time and blend until desired consistency is reached. Add paprika, cayenne pepper, and cumin; blend until incorporated.

input_text: I have tomatoes, sandwich bread, cheese, mayonnaise, kim, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Kim Chee Sandwich with Kim Chee, mayonnaise, tomatoes, sandwich bread, 1 slice cheese, dash of salt. Here's the instruction: Spread mayonnaise on both pieces of bread. Lay single slice of cheese on bread. Lay Kim Chee over the cheese, covering the bread. Lay sliced tomatoes over the Kim Chee and sprinkle the tomatoes with salt. Cover the tomatoes with the other slice of bread. Now go for it and broke mouth...

input_text: I have cream of chicken soup, onion, margarine, broccoli, milk, rice. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Broccoli And Rice Casserole with 1 box chopped broccoli (frozen), 1 chopped onion, 3 Tbsp. margarine, 1 can cream of chicken soup, 1/2 can (soup) milk, 1 (8 oz.) jar Cheez Whiz, 1 c. rice, cooked. Here's the instruction: Saute onion in margarine. Add broccoli and cook until thawed. Add remaining ingredients. Pour into baking dish. Bake 30 minutes at 350°.

input_text: I have flour, campbell's cheddar cheese, sausage, water. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Cheese And Sausage Balls with 1 lb. sausage (hot or medium), 1/2 c. water, 1 can Campbell's Cheddar cheese, 3 c. Bisquick/self-rising flour. Here's the instruction: Brown sausage. Mix sausage, Cheddar cheese and water. Stir in the Bisquick/self-rising flour. Drop in small muffin tins. Bake at 400° until brown.

input_text: I have tomato, fresh herbs, sour cream, dressing, ¼, fresh squeezed lemon juice, water, celery, bibb lettuce, ground black pepper, walnuts, olives, bay leaf, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Hummus Lentil Salad Lettuce Wraps with 1-1/4 cup Dry French Green Lentils, Rinsed, 2-1/2 cups Water, 1 whole Dried Bay Leaf, 1/2 teaspoons Salt, 20 whole Pitted Kalamata Olives, Sliced Or Roughly Chopped, 1/4 cups Finely Chopped Red Onion, 1 whole Roma/plum Tomato, Seeded And Chopped, 1 cup Chopped Celery Or Bell Pepper, 1/3 cups Chopped Walnuts, Preferably Toasted, 2 Tablespoons Chopped Fresh Herbs, Such As Parsley, Oregano, Or Even Mint, 12 whole Large Leaves Of Romaine Or Bibb Lettuce, FOR THE DRESSING:, 1/3 cups Sour Cream (or Greek Yogurt, Preferably NOT Non-fat), 2/3 cups Plain Hummus, 2 Tablespoons Fresh Squeezed Lemon Juice, 1/2 teaspoons Salt, 1 pinch Ground Black Pepper, Or More To Taste. Here's the instruction: Combine lentils, water, bay leaf, and salt in a medium saucepan over high heat. Bring to a boil, then simmer uncovered until lentils are tender but not falling apart, about 20 minutes. Drain, rinse with cold water, and remove the bay leaf. Transfer to a medium mixing bowl and set in the fridge to cool. Combine sour cream, hummus, lemon juice, salt, and ground black pepper to taste to make the dressing. Add olives, vegetables, nuts, and herbs to the lentils, then pour in the dressing. Stir gently until everything is well mixed and adjust seasoning as needed. Serve lettuce leaves and lentil salad family-style, letting everyone scoop plenty of filling onto each piece of lettuce. If you have any of the salad ingredients leftover, serve as extra toppings. The lentil salad keeps well for a couple days in the fridge-just stir to remedy any separation caused by the water content of the tomatoes. The recipe is gluten-free and vegetarian as written.

input_text: I have red wine vinegar, bacon, sugar, endive curly, tomatoes, boston lettuce, eggs, chicken breast halves, watercress coarse, avocados, roquefort cheese, chives, mustard, olive oil, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Refreshing Cobb Salad with 1/2 each romaine lettuce rinsed, spun or patted dry, and coarsely chopped, 1/2 each boston lettuce rinsed, spun or patted dry, and coarsely chopped, 1 bunch belgian endive curly, rinsed, spun or patted dry, and coarsely chopped, 1/2 bunch watercress coarse stems discarded, rinsed, spun or patted dry, and coarsely chopped, 6 slices bacon, 2 each avocados ripe, seed removed, peeled, and cut into 1/2-inch pieces, 1 whole chicken breast halves, boneless, skinless cooked, and diced, 1 each tomatoes seeded and chopped fine, 2 large eggs hard-boiled, separated, the yolk finely chopped and the white finely chopped, 2 tablespoons chives chopped fresh, 13 cup red wine vinegar, 1 dash dijon mustard, 2 tablespoons sugar, salt and black pepper to taste, 23 cup olive oil, 1/2 cup roquefort cheese finely grated. Here's the instruction: In a large salad bowl, toss together well the various lettuces and watercress. Cook the bacon in a skillet on medium heat until crisp on both sides. Remove from skillet and lay out on paper towels to absorb the excess fat. Allow the bacon to cool. Crumble the bacon and set aside. Compose the salad. Arrange the chicken, the bacon, the tomato, and the avocado decoratively over the greens and garnish the salad with the grated egg and the chives. In a small bowl whisk together the vinegar, the mustard, and salt and pepper to taste, add the oil in a slow stream, whisking, and whisk the dressing until it is emulsified. Stir in the Roquefort. Add sugar to taste, 1/2 teaspoon at a time. Whisk the dressing. Serve separately or toss in with the salad.

input_text: I have wedge, sauce, lime juice, orange juice, kosher salt, tomato juice, lager, worcestershire sauce. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Michelada  with Lime wedge, Kosher salt, 1 1/2 ounces fresh lime juice, 1 ounce tomato juice, 1/2 ounce fresh orange juice, 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce, Hot sauce, Mexican lager. Here's the instruction: Rub the rim of a pint glass with a lime wedge and dip in kosher salt; fill glass with ice. Add 1 1/2 ounces fresh lime juice, 1 ounce tomato juice, 1/2 ounce fresh orange juice, and 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce; season with hot sauce. Top off with cold Mexican lager and stir to combine.

input_text: I have white chocolate, peanut butter, peanut. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Peanut Brittle Candy Slabs with 2 (12-oz.) packages white chocolate morsels, 2 cups crushed storebought peanut brittle, divided, 1/2 cup plus 3 Tbsp. creamy peanut butter. Here's the instruction: Line 3 (9" x 5") loaf pans with multipurpose sealing wrap (we tested with Press 'N Seal); set aside. (Use disposable loaf pans from the grocery store, if desired.) Microwave white chocolate morsels in a large microwave-safe bowl at 70% power for 1 minute and 15 seconds. (Morsels will not look melted.) Stir morsels until melted. Microwave again at 15-second intervals, if necessary. Gently fold 1 1/2 cups peanut brittle and 1/2 cup peanut butter into melted chocolate, stirring until evenly distributed. Quickly spread melted white chocolate evenly in prepared pans. Dollop 1 Tbsp. creamy peanut butter over candy mixture in each loaf pan; swirl with a knife. Sprinkle with reserved 1/2 cup crushed peanut brittle, pressing gently with fingertips. Let stand 1 hour or until firm.

input_text: I have cayenne pepper, red bell pepper, olive oil, water. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Pepper Coulis with 1 red bell pepper (or yellow about 10 oz.), 1 tablespoon water, 1 teaspoon olive oil, salt to taste, cayenne pepper. Here's the instruction: Rinse 1 red or yellow bell pepper (about 10 oz.); pat dry. Set pepper in a 9-inch pie or cake pan and broil 3 to 4 inches from heat, turning as needed, until charred on all sides, about 15 minutes total. Let cool. With a small, sharp knife, remove and discard skin, stem, and seeds. Coarsely chop pepper and place in a blender or food processor. Add 1 tablespoon water and 1 teaspoon olive oil; whirl until smooth. Add salt and cayenne to taste. If coulis is thicker than desired, thin with 1 to 2 more tablespoons water.

input_text: I have egg substitute, potato, pepper, scallions, cooking spray, green chili pepper, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Healthy Rolled Green Chili & Potato Omelette with 12 cup egg substitute, 12 teaspoon salt, 12 teaspoon pepper, 1 green chili pepper, fresh roasted, peeled, seeded, and cut into long strips, 14 cup potato, the frozen shredded variety with onions and peppers, 2 tablespoons scallions, thawed, cooking spray. Here's the instruction: Coat a small Omelette pan with Non-stick cooking spray and bring to medium heat. Pour in Egg substitute mixed with the salt and pepper. Cook as an omelet, and flip when ready so the other side begins to cook. The egg should be very thin, so be careful when flipping. Add layers of potatoes, green chili, and scallions to the cooked side. Turn off heat. Roll omelet, as if you are making a sushi roll or rolling a taquito. Be very careful as to not break the thin egg mixture. Serve with your favorite salsa, ketchup, hot sauce, or whatever you like on your breakfast eggs & potatoes.

input_text: I have syrup, white wine. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Christmas in a Glass with 1 bottle Prosecco, or other sparkling dry white wine, well chilled, 1 bottle gingerbread flavored syrup (or cranberry flavored syrup). Here's the instruction: Pour the Prosecco into glasses. Add a capful of the syrup to each glass of the Prosecco, to taste.

input_text: I have black beans, corn, tomatoes, salt, pepper, cayenne pepper, chili powder, onion, cilantro leaf, cumin powder, avocados, vegetable broth, sweet potato. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Black Bean, Sweet Potato Chili with 8 cups vegetable broth, 1 sweet potato, peeled & diced small, 3 tomatoes, peeled & diced, 12 onion, diced, 2 cups black beans (pre-cooked or canned), 1 cup corn (fresh or frozen), 2 tablespoons miso (any color), 1 tablespoon chili powder, 1 tablespoon cumin powder, 2 avocados, peeled & diced, 1 cup cilantro leaf, 1 dash cayenne pepper (to taste), salt (to taste), pepper (to taste). Here's the instruction: Put all the ingredients, EXCEPT the avocados, cilantro and last 3 spices, in a large pot and bring to boil. Reduce the heat and simmer on low for 30 minutes, or desired tenderness of vegetables. Season with salt and pepper to your preference. Youll need more salt if you used water instead of broth. Add the avocado, cilantro, cayenne pepper, salt and pepper to taster (per serving).

input_text: I have cold milk. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Mousse In A Minute with 1 (4 serving size) pkg. Jell-O instant pudding and pie filling, 1 1/2 c. cold milk, 1 c. thawed Cool Whip. Here's the instruction: Prepare pudding mix as directed on the package using 1 1/2 cups milk. Fold in the Cool Whip if desired. Makes 2 2/3 cups or 5 servings.

input_text: I have ground pork, oregano, chili powder, dry red wine, white vinegar, ground beef, garlic, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Homemade Chorizo with 1 1/2 lbs ground beef, 1 1/2 lbs ground pork, 3/4 cup chili powder, 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano, 4 garlic cloves, minced, 2 teaspoons salt, 3/4 cup dry red wine, 1/4 cup white vinegar. Here's the instruction: Mix all ingredients in a bowl with your hands. Or alternatively, you can mix in batches in a food processor in batches giving a finer texture almost like a paste. Store in an airtight container or large zip-lock bag in the refrigerator. Let sit at least a day or two in the refrigerator before using. You can also put some in the freezer for later use. To use: Pour a little canola or vegetable oil in a frying pan and heat over medium high-heat. Add the chorizo and cook through.

input_text: I have chicken breasts, bell pepper, flour tortillas, onion, stir-fry seasoning mix, vegetable oil. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Chicken Fajitas with 4 skinned and deboned chicken breasts, cut into strips 1/4-inch wide, 2 Tbsp. vegetable oil, 1 large onion, sliced into thin strips, 1 bell pepper, sliced into thin strips, 1 pkg. Kikkoman stir-fry seasoning mix, soft flour tortillas. Here's the instruction: In wok or skillet, heat oil, then cook chicken until done. Add onion and pepper; stir and cook 2 minutes. Add 2 tablespoons water to stir-fry mix to dissolve. Put in skillet and cook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Prepare tortillas according to package directions. Put small amount of chicken mixture down center of tortilla and fold up envelope style. Serves 4. Prep time: 30 minutes.

input_text: I have mushroom stems, ground mustard, pepper, eggs, swiss cheese, onion, pastry shell, cream, italian sausage, green pepper, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Sausage Mushroom Quiche with 1/2 pound bulk Italian sausage, cooked and drained, 1 cup shredded Swiss cheese, 1 can (4 ounces) mushroom stems and pieces, drained, 1/4 cup finely chopped green pepper, 1 tablespoon dried minced onion, 1 frozen deep-dish pastry shell (9 inches), 5 large eggs, 3/4 cup half-and-half cream, 1/2 teaspoon ground mustard, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Here's the instruction: In a large bowl, combine the sausage, cheese, mushrooms, green pepper and onion; sprinkle into pastry shell. In a small bowl, combine the eggs, cream, mustard, salt and pepper; pour over sausage mixture. Bake at 375° for 35-40 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Let stand for 10 minutes before cutting.

input_text: I have granules, ginger, gelatin, sweet corn kernels, green beans, carrots, chicory, olives, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Early Summer Appetizer Chicory and Vegetable Bouquet with 4 Chicory, 2 Carrots (sweet), 2 Green beans, 2 Sweet corn kernels, 4 small Asparagus, 1 Olives (black), 1 Salt, 1 1/2 tsp Grated ginger, 1/2 tsp Soup stock granules, 1 Salt and pepper, 3 grams Gelatin. Here's the instruction: For the ginger jelly, put 50 ml of water, the ginger, stock granules, and salt and pepper in a small saucepan and bring to the boil. Transfer it to a plastic container, and add the dissolved gelatin while still hot. Leave it to harden for 2 hours and then break it up with a fork. Prepare the vegetables Prepare some ice water and a sieve. Soak the washed chicory. Cut the other vegetables small enough to fit on top of the chicory "boat". Bring some water to the boil, add some salt, and boil the vegetables. When their colour becomes vivid, soak in cold water to prevent discolouring. Place the vegetables on the chicory "boat", and top with the ginger jelly and your favourite herbs to finish. Bonus: The tomato "boat" was made by topping a yellow cherry tomato with cream cheese and placing it on a slice of cured ham.

input_text: I have ground pork, cabbage, sugar, pepper, vermicelli, garlic salt, eggs, egg roll wraps, mushrooms, onion, chicken breast, carrot, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Joe's Mom's Egg Rolls with 12 lb ground pork, 12 lb chicken breast, 3 carrot sticks, 12 head cabbage, 4 ounces sliced mushrooms, drained, 12 medium onion, 1 78 ounces vermicelli (bean thread), 12 teaspoon pepper, 1 teaspoon sugar, 12 teaspoon salt, 2 eggs, 12 teaspoon garlic salt, 1 (16 ounce) package egg roll wraps. Here's the instruction: Cook ground pork and chicken breast and chop until fine. Chop carrots, cabbage, mushrooms, and onion very finely. Put vermicelli in a bowl of warm water for 15 minutes. Remove, drain and cut into 1-1/2 inch sections. Mix meat, vegetables, pepper, sugar, salt, eggs, garlic salt and vermicelli in a bowl. Heat up cooking oil to 400 degrees. Follow directions on egg roll wrap package to add filling and fold wrap. Cook until golden brown.

input_text: I have sugar, vanilla, baking soda, white corn syrup, butter, peanuts, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Peanut Brittle(Microwave)   with 1 c. raw peanuts, 1 c. sugar, 1/8 tsp. salt, 1/2 c. white corn syrup, 1 tsp. butter, 1 tsp. vanilla, 1 tsp. baking soda. Here's the instruction: Put in 1 1/2-quart bowl. Stir together the peanuts, sugar, syrup and salt. Microwave for 3 minutes. Stir. Microwave for 2 minutes. Add butter and vanilla; microwave 2 minutes and 15 seconds. Add soda and put on buttered pan. Break up when cool.

input_text: I have white syrup, sugar, vanilla, egg whites, water, nuts. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Divinity with 4 c. sugar, 1 1/4 c. water, 1 c. white syrup, 3 egg whites, 1 c. nuts, chopped, 1 Tbsp. vanilla. Here's the instruction: Mix well 1 cup sugar and 1/2 cup water, then heat to boiling until mixture strings. Pour over three well beaten egg whites. In separate pan, mix 3 cups sugar, 1 cup white syrup and 3/4 cup water. Heat to boiling until brittle when tried in cold water. Add 2nd mixture to 1st mixture, pouring gradually. Beat until stiff. Add 1 cup chopped nuts and vanilla. Pour by teaspoon onto waxed paper. Let cool.

input_text: I have sugar, corn syrup, baking soda, butter, peanuts. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Peanut Brittle with 3 c. sugar, 1 1/2 c. Karo corn syrup, 3 oz. butter, 1 lb. raw peanuts, 1 1/2 tsp. baking soda. Here's the instruction: Cook sugar, corn syrup and butter to 240°. Add raw peanuts. Cook to 290°. Add 1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda and remove from heat. Pour mixture onto buttered marble slab or buttered cookie sheet. Cool and break into pieces.

input_text: I have egg, sorrel, baby spinach, eggs, pastry, garlic, goat's cheese, flour, parsley, cream, filling, butter, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Little Wild Sorrel And Herb Tarts With Melted Goat'S Cheese with Pastry, 225 g plain flour, 150 g butter, 1 egg, Filling, 250 g baby spinach leaves, 50 g sorrel, parsley, basil, chives and tarragon (A small bunch each of herb), garlic clove, 2 eggs, 300 ml single cream, salt and pepper, garlic and nutmeg, 300 g goat's cheese. Here's the instruction: Preheat the oven to 170C (325F, Gas mark 3). For the pastry, rub the butter into the flour and bind with the egg, then allow it to rest for half an hour. Roll out the pastry and line six individual tart tins or 1 large tin. Wash the spinach, sorrel and herbs if necessary and dry them well. Shred the spinach and sorrel. Heat a pan with a little oil and stir fry the spinach and sorrel until it collapses. Remove from the pan and spread out on a plate to allow it to cool quickly. Chop the herbs, crush a sliver of garlic and place in a bowl with the eggs and cream. Add the spinach and sorrel, the seasoning and the nutmeg. Spoon into the tarts. Cook in the oven until the egg mixture is just set, about 15-20 minutes. They do not need to be fully cooked. Allow to cool. To serve, take the tarts out of the tins and place on an oven tray. Increase the oven heat to 200C (400F, Gas mark 6). Place a thick slice of the goat's cheese on the top of each tart and put them back in the oven for about 10 minutes. Serve on a bed of dressed salad leaves.

input_text: I have egg, sambal oelek, spring roll wrappers, chicken breasts, gingerroot, peanut oil, carrot, bean sprouts, white cabbage, garlic, red onion, bamboo shoots, trassi oedang, ketjap manis. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Indonesian Loempia'S with 4 -6 large spring roll wrappers, 1 egg, beaten, 8 ounces cooked chicken breasts, sliced into thin strips, 1 medium red onion, thinly chopped, 1 garlic clove, minced, 1 inch fresh gingerroot, minced, 1 teaspoon sambal oelek, 1 teaspoon trassi oedang, 10 ounces white cabbage, thinly sliced, 8 ounces bean sprouts, 1 (6 ounce) can bamboo shoots, 1 large carrot, shredded, 1 tablespoon ketjap manis, 2 tablespoons peanut oil. Here's the instruction: Heat your wok and add the oil. Add onion, ginger, minced garlic and soften in wok. Add the Sambal and trassi and cook for a further 2 minutes. Add the vegetables, chicken and ketjap manis. Toss until vegetables are soft and "just" cooked. To make the Loempia's: Spread out 2 spring roll sheets one on top of the other with the corners opposite from each other. Spoon in a generous amount of filling to the top center spring roll sheet. Fold in the top and bottom corners over the filling. Fold in the left and right corners making sure the filling is packed tight. Next fold in the second spring roll over the first in the opposite direction. Spread some beaten egg over the final folds to help them stick. Fry in hot oil for about 5 minutes, making sure both sides are browned equally. Serve with peanutsauce or just Ketjap manis and sambal.

input_text: I have buttermilk, sugar, vanilla, baking powder, eggs, baking soda, brown sugar, flour, frozen rhubarb, ground cinnamon, butter, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Rhubarb-Buttermilk Coffee Cake with 2 cups diced fresh or frozen rhubarb, 1/4 cup plus 2/3 cup sugar, divided, 1/2 cup butter, softened, 2 large eggs, 1-1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 1-1/2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/8 teaspoon baking soda, 3/4 cup buttermilk, 2 tablespoons brown sugar, 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon. Here's the instruction: Preheat oven to 350°. In a small bowl, combine rhubarb and 1/4 cup sugar. In a large bowl, cream butter and remaining sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in vanilla. In another bowl, whisk flour, baking powder, salt and baking soda; add to creamed mixture alternately with buttermilk, beating well after each addition. Fold in rhubarb mixture. Pour into a greased 9-in. square baking pan. In a small bowl, mix brown sugar and cinnamon; sprinkle over batter. Bake 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Serve warm or at room temperature.

input_text: I have condensed milk, vanilla, brown sugar, nuts, margarine. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Penuche with 1 c. brown sugar, 1/3 c. condensed milk, 1/2 tsp. vanilla, 1 Tbsp. margarine, 1/3 c. nuts, chopped. Here's the instruction: Boil sugar and milk, stirring to prevent scorching. Cook to soft ball stage (235° to 240°). Remove from heat; let cool after adding butter or margarine. Add vanilla. Beat until creamy. Add nuts. Pour quickly into greased pan. Makes 12 (1-inch) squares.

input_text: I have pepper, onion, worcestershire sauce, crabmeat, celery, mayonnaise, buttered bread crumbs, shrimp, salad dressing, green pepper, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Crab-Shrimp Bake with 1 medium green pepper, chopped, 1 medium onion, chopped, 1 c. celery, finely chopped, 1 (6 1/2 or 7 1/2 oz.) can crabmeat, flaked, 1 c. cooked, cleaned shrimp, 1/2 tsp. salt, dash of pepper, 1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce, 1/2 c. mayonnaise, 1/2 c. salad dressing, 1 c. buttered bread crumbs. Here's the instruction: Drain all ingredients well. Then combine ingredients except crumbs. Place in individual seashells, in pastry shells or in a 2-quart casserole. Sprinkle with buttered crumbs. Bake in 350° oven about 20 to 25 minutes or longer if in one dish.

input_text: I have molasses, white sugar. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make How To Make Brown Sugar with white sugar, unsulphured molasses. Here's the instruction: Mix by hand, it's faster.

input_text: I have soy sauce, sherry wine, arrowroot, onion, water, hoisin sauce, sauce, sesame oil, red bell pepper, carrot, rice, fry, sugar snap pea, beef, vegetable oil, vegetable broth, chile sauce. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Kumquat'S Spicy Oriental Stir-Fry with Sauce, 3 tablespoons soy sauce, 3 tablespoons sherry wine, 2 tablespoons hoisin sauce (Lee Kum Kee brand recommended), 1 tablespoon chile sauce with garlic, 1 teaspoon arrowroot (or 2 1/2 teaspoons cornstarch), 3/4 cup vegetable broth, Stir-Fry, 1 teaspoon vegetable oil, 1 teaspoon sesame oil, 1 cup carrot, peeled and sliced diagonally (about 2), 1 cup sugar snap pea, trimmed, 1 small red bell pepper, cut into small strips, 1 small onion, chopped, 8 8 ounces cooked beef or 8 ounces cooked chicken, cut into strips, 3 -4 scallions, sliced, Rice, 1 cup rice, 1 cup vegetable broth, 1 cup water. Here's the instruction: Assemble vegetables. Meanwhile, bring broth and water to boil, add rice and cover. Reduce heat to low and simmer 20 minutes (or follow instructions on box, omitting salt and butter). Whisk together sauce ingredients in a small bowl. In medium wok or large skillet, heat vegetable and sesame oils under medium-high setting. Add carrots and stir-fry 1-2 minutes. Add snow peas and stir-fry 1-2 minutes. Add pepper and onion (at the same time) and stir-fry 1-2 minutes. Add meat substitute or meat and stir-fry 1-2 minutes. Pour sauce over vegetable mixture. Heat to boiling while stirring, and simmer under reduced heat until until vegetables are crisp-tender (about 1-2 minutes or more). Spoon over hot rice, sprinkle with scallions and serve.

input_text: I have walnuts, cherry pie filling, butter, pineapple, yellow cake. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Dump Cake with 1 large can (20 oz.) crushed pineapple, 1 can cherry pie filling, 1 (15 oz.) pkg. yellow cake mix, 3/4 c. butter or margarine, 1 c. chopped walnuts (optional). Here's the instruction: Dump pineapple in buttered 9 by 13 inch pan. Add cherry pie filling on top. Sprinkle dry cake mix over fruit. Dot with butter. Top with chopped nut, if desired. Bake for 45 minutes at 375°. Serve warm with sweetened whipped cream or ice cream.

input_text: I have oil, tomato, curry, water, yellow onion, coriander, pumpkin, paprika, turmeric, garlic, chicken, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make My Perfect Chicken with 1 kg chicken drumsticks, Rapeseed oil, 1 Yellow onion, 4 cloves Garlic, 1 tbsp curry, 1 tsp smoked paprika, 1 tbsp Coriander, 0.5 tbsp Turmeric, Salt, 1 Tomato, 1 Potato or 1.5 cup Pumpkin, Boiled water. Here's the instruction: Chop the onion and press the garlic cloves Heat up a deep pan with the oil and add the onion and garlic and allow to get a little color Wash the drumsticks and make a few cuts into them Add the chicken to the pan a sear slightly Add the curry, smoked paprika, coriander, turmeric and salt and sear properly. Add boiled water until it covers the chicken and let boil or simmer Add chopped tomsto, cubed pumpkin and cubed potato after half time It is ready when the sauce has thickened

input_text: I have sugar, vanilla extract, water, cocoa, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Chocolate Syrup with 1 c. cocoa, dash of salt, 1 1/2 c. sugar, 1 c. hot water, 2 tsp. vanilla extract. Here's the instruction: Mix sugar, salt and cocoa in pan. Add some water to make paste. Add remainder of water. Bring to boil, stirring constantly. Boil 3 minutes. Remove from heat and add vanilla.

input_text: I have heavy cream, shallots, white wine, tarragon, almonds, garlic, mustard, chicken. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text:
You can make Mustard-Braised Chicken  with 8 chicken thighs, skin on, 5 tablespoons Dijon mustard, 2 shallots, thinly sliced, 2 garlic cloves, minced, 1 cup white wine (whatever you're pouring will work best), 1/2 cup heavy cream, 1/2 cup toasted sliced almonds, 1/4 cup tarragon, minced
 10 ounces spinach. Here's the instruction: 1. Preheat the oven to 400° F. Cover the chicken thighs in 4 tablespoons of the mustard and season with salt. Heat 2 tablespoons of cooking oil in a heavy-bottomed saute pan over medium-high heat, then add the chicken thighs, skin side down. After the skins have browned, remove the chicken thighs and reserve.  2. Add the sliced shallots and cook until soft, around 3 to 4 minutes, then add the garlic and cook for an additional 30 seconds. Add the wine and scrape up the browned bits on the pan with a spatula. When the wine comes to a boil, reduce the heat to a simmer, then add the chicken thighs back to the pan, skin side up. Add water if necessary so that the liquid level reaches three-quarters of the way up the chicken, then place the pan in the oven for 30 minutes.  3. While the chicken is cooking, bring salted water to a boil in a medium-size pot. Add the spinach and cook until bright green, around 2 to 3 minutes, strain and reserve.  4. When the chicken is done, remove the pan from the oven, and then remove the chicken from the pan and reserve. Strain the sauce, reserving the shallots. Pour the sauce back into the pan and bring to a boil on the stove over high heat. Add the remaining teaspoon of mustard and cook, stirring, until the sauce has reduced by half. Turn off the heat and stir in the heavy cream to finish the sauce. Plate the chicken on a bed of spinach and shallots and top with a few spoonfuls of the sauce and a sprinkle of sliced almonds and minced tarragon. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

input_text: I have apricots, condensed milk, milk chocolate chips, coconut, vegetable oil. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Chocolate Apricot Truffles with 5 oz finely chopped dried apricots, 1 cup desiccated coconut, 1/3 cup sweetened condensed milk, plus 2 tbsp, 7 oz milk chocolate chips, 2 tsp vegetable oil. Here's the instruction: Line a baking tray with parchment paper. Combine apricots, coconut and 1/3 cup condensed milk. Roll level tablespoons of mixture into balls and place in a single layer on prepared tray. Combine chocolate and oil in a microwave-safe bowl. Cook on MEDIUM-LOW (30%) for 2 mins, stirring occasionally, until chocolate is melted. Working with 1 ball at a time, use a fork to coat balls into chocolate then place on tray. Sprinkle with a little of the remaining coconut. Freeze balls until set.

input_text: I have egg, sugar, stuffing, raisins, apricot, milk, allspice, butter. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Grandma Hermann's Filsel with 1 12 cups raisins, 1 cup dried apricot, chopped, 12 lb melted butter, 10 ounces cubed prepared stuffing (Mrs. Cubbinson's, Herb Flavored), 1 12 cups heated milk, 1 cup sugar, 14 teaspoon allspice, 1 beaten egg. Here's the instruction: Preheat oven to 350F In a large bowl mix stuffing, melted butter, and milk. Add sugar and allspice. Stir in raisins, apricots, and eggs. Let stand until mixture is absorbed. Bake in greased, covered casserole at 350F for about 1 hour. Keep a good watch on it to make sure it doesn't over brown. Test center to ensure egg is cooked thoroughly.

input_text: I have vinegar, curry powder, onion, celery, mayonnaise, rice, shrimp, vegetable oil, green pepper. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Shrimp Curry Rice with 1/4 c. chopped onion, 2 Tbsp. vegetable oil, 1 Tbsp. vinegar, 1/2 tsp. curry powder, 1 1/2 c. cooked rice, 1 c. diced celery, 1/4 c. diced green pepper, 2 1/2 c. cooked shrimp, 3/4 c. mayonnaise. Here's the instruction: Combine onion, vinegar, oil and curry powder in a bowl. Stir in rice and chill 2 hours to blend flavors. Just before serving, add celery, green pepper, shrimp and mayonnaise (cut shrimp in desired pieces). Serve on lettuce. Serves 6.

input_text: I have american cheese, pepper, curry powder, mozzarella cheese, mushroom soup, paprika, thin noodles, chicken. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Chicken Noodle Casserole with 1 large pkg. thin noodles, 2 cans mushroom soup, 3 c. diced cooked chicken, pepper to taste, paprika to taste, 3 Tbsp. curry powder, 1 (8 oz.) pkg. sliced American cheese, 1 (8 oz.) pkg. sliced Mozzarella cheese. Here's the instruction: Cook the noodles according to package directions. Drain. Add soup, chicken, pepper, paprika and curry powder. Mix well. Place alternate layers of noodle mixture and cheeses in a casserole. Bake at 350° until bubbly.

input_text: I have onion, crabmeat, celery, mayonnaise, shrimp, butter, bread crumbs, worcestershire sauce, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Seafood Casserole with 2 c. large raw shrimp, peeled, 1 1/2 c. crabmeat, 2 c. chopped celery, 3/4 c. minced onion, 1 c. mayonnaise, 2 tsp. Worcestershire sauce, salt and pepper to taste, 1 1/2 c. bread crumbs, 1/2 stick melted butter. Here's the instruction: Mix first 7 ingredients together and pour into a casserole dish. Mix bread crumbs and butter together. Sprinkle over casserole. Bake at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes.

input_text: I have coffee, honey, milk. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Greek Iced Coffee By Pallas with 1/2 cup coffee, 1/2 cup milk, 2 tsp honey. Here's the instruction: Blend all ingredients with 1/2 cup of ice. Pour into a glass or mug. Enjoy!

input_text: I have sugar, vanilla, eggs, cinnamon, baking soda, flour, margarine, walnuts, apples, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Apple Brownies with 1 stick margarine or butter, melted, 2 c. sugar, 2 eggs, 2 tsp. vanilla, 2 c. flour, 1 tsp. cinnamon, 1 tsp. baking soda, 1/4 tsp. salt, 4 c. diced apples, 3/4 to 1 c. chopped walnuts (if desired). Here's the instruction: Mix all ingredients together, except for apples and nuts. Then add the apples and nuts to mixture. (If using McIntosh apples, add an extra 1/2 to 2/3 cup flour.) Bake at 350° for 35 to 40 minutes. Test with toothpick.

input_text: I have baking powder, ¼, water, flour, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Flour Tortillas with 2 cups All Purpose White Flour, 1 teaspoon Baking Powder, 1/2 teaspoons Salt, 1/4 cups Shortening, 2/3 cups Warm Water. Here's the instruction: Mix dry ingredients together in bowl. Cut in shortening until mixture resembles course meal. I use my food processor for this but you can do it anyway you like. Add warm(~105 deg) water and mix until you get a pliable dough. Put on floured surface and kneed until dough is elastic. Let dough rest for at least 20 minutes.(very important) Make into 10 balls. Heat griddle/ pan over a med to med/hot flame. Do not oil the pan. Roll out balls to less than an 1/8 inch, you want them thin. Put immediately onto griddle/pan. Cook for approx 10 seconds on each side. On the first side you will see bubbles form, flip when the bubbles form. (if bubbles don't form then the griddle is not hot enough) Store wrapped in clean tea towel until ready to serve. Once cool they can be stored in the fridge. Makes 10 Notes: you can subsitute lard for shortening, they would be more authentic and taste yummy, but we are watching cholestorol around here.

input_text: I have mozzarella cheese, pork sausage, black olives, muffins, chili. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Little Pizzas with 1 bag plain English muffins, 2 to 3 cans chili (without beans), cooked pork sausage (small pieces), grated Mozzarella cheese, sliced black olives. Here's the instruction: Spread chili on each half of English muffin. Add olives, sausage and cheese. Broil until bubbly.

input_text: I have sugar, vanilla, marshmallow cream, peanut butter, margarine, milk. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Peanut Butter Fudge with 3 c. sugar, 2/3 c. evaporated milk, 1 (7 oz.) jar marshmallow cream, 3/4 c. margarine, 1 c. peanut butter, 1 tsp. vanilla. Here's the instruction: In a heavy 2 1/2-quart saucepan, combine sugar, margarine and milk. Bring to a full boil, stirring constantly. Continue boiling over medium heat for 5 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Add peanut butter, stirring until well blended. Add marshmallow cream and vanilla and beat until well blended. Spread in a buttered 13 x 9 x 2-inch pan. Cool at room temperature and refrigerate. Cut into squares when firm. Makes 3 pounds of candy.

input_text: I have cinnamon, sugar, lemon juice, berries arbutus. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Arbutus Berry Jam with 3 2/3 cups berries arbutus, 1 1/2 cups sugar, 1 cinnamon stick, 1/2 lemon juice. Here's the instruction: In a saucepan, add the rinsed arbutus, sugar, cinnamon stick and lemon juice. Mix well. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Lower heat and simmer for about 30 minutes, until the jam reaches setting point or 220°F. Remove the cinnamon stick and puree with a hand blender. Pour the jam into sterilized jars, let cool and refrigerate.

input_text: I have fresh beef brisket, horseradish, canola oil, mushrooms, celery, cold water, onions, carrots, worcestershire sauce, tomato sauce. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Braised Hanukkah Brisket with 2 tablespoons canola oil, 1 fresh beef brisket (4 to 5 pounds), 3 celery ribs, cut into 1-inch pieces, 3 large carrots, cut into 1/4-inch slices, 2 large onions, sliced, 1 pound medium fresh mushrooms, 3/4 cup cold water, 3/4 cup tomato sauce, 3 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce, 1 tablespoon prepared horseradish. Here's the instruction: In a Dutch oven, heat oil over medium heat. Brown brisket on both sides. Remove from pan. Add celery, carrots and onions to same pan; cook and stir 4-6 minutes or until crisp-tender. Stir in remaining ingredients. Return brisket to pan, fat side up. Bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer, covered, 2-1/2 to 3 hours or until meat is tender. Remove beef and vegetables; keep warm. Skim fat from pan juices. If desired, thicken juices. Cut brisket diagonally across the grain into thin slices. Serve with vegetables and pan juices.

input_text: I have black pepper, mixed mushrooms, onion, meatballs, ground venison, flour, sauce, red wine, paprika, garlic, butter, worcestershire sauce. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Venison Meatballs In Wine Sauce with Meatballs, 1 lb ground venison, 1/4 cup minced onion, 1 teaspoon paprika, 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce, 1 tablespoon flour, 1 teaspoon black pepper, fresh ground, Sauce, 4 tablespoons butter, 1 onion, cut in rings, 1 garlic clove, 1/2 cup mixed mushrooms, diced, 4 tablespoons flour, 1/2 cup red wine. Here's the instruction: Mix venison, onion, paprika, Worcestershire sauce, flour, and black pepper together for meatballs. Form mixture into small balls. Bake the meatballs at 425 degrees Fahrenheit for 10 minutes until just done but still soft . For the sauce, melt butter in a pan; fry onion and garlic; add mushrooms. Add meat balls and juice. Fry 5 minutes; add wine; simmer until sauce thickens.

input_text: I have tomatoes, cucumbers, water, extra virgin olive oil salt, red, white bread, sherry, garlic. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Basic Red Gazpacho Recipe with 3 lb Ripe tomatoes, roughly minced, 1 x Red or possibly yellow bell pepper, seeded, stemmed, and roughly minced. Don't USE GREEN BELL PEPPER!, 2 x Pickling (Kirby) cucumbers, peeled and roughly minced, 4 slc good stale white bread, crusts removed, 6 c. Cool water, 1 lrg Or possibly 2 sm cloves garlic, peeled, 1/4 c. Sherry or possibly good wine vinegar, or possibly to taste, 1/2 c. Extra virgin olive oil Salt and freshly grnd black pepper to taste Garlic croutons, if you like for garnish. Here's the instruction: Mince a bit of the tomato, pepper, and cucumber for garnish, and set aside. Soak bread in a c. of the water for 5 min, then squeeze out excess water. Place bread in a blender or possibly food processor with the remaining tomato, pepper, cucumber and water, garlic and vinegar; process till smooth, then add in extra virgin olive oil slowly with machine running. Season to taste with salt and pepper and chill till ready to serve. Before serving, check seasoning again, and garnish with reserved tomato, pepper, cucumber, and garlic croutons.

input_text: I have italian seasoning, lemon juice, lemon zest, parmesan cheese, stock, angel hair pasta, kosher salt, garlic, chickpeas, flat leaf parsley, olive oil. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Chickpea Pasta With Lemon with 1 tablespoon olive oil, 3 garlic cloves, chopped, 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice, 1 teaspoon lemon zest, 2 teaspoons italian seasoning, kosher salt, 4 cups stock (vegetable or chicken), 1 lb angel hair pasta (or gluten-free pasta variety of choice), 15 1/2 ounces chickpeas, drained and rinsed (1 can), 1 cup flat leaf parsley, chopped, 1/2 cup parmesan cheese, grated (optional). Here's the instruction: Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Stir in the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the stock, Italian seasoning, and 3/4 teaspoon salt and bring to a boil. Add the pasta and cook, stirring, until the stock is nearly absorbed and the pasta is al dente (check package directions for cook time). Stir in the chickpeas, parsley, lemon juice and lemon zest and let cook additional 1 - 2 minutes. Divide among individual bowls and top with Parmesan or dairy free cheese (if using).

input_text: I have green food coloring, vanilla, marshmallows, corn flakes, red cinnamon, margarine. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Holly Wreaths with 3/4 stick margarine, 24 large marshmallows, 1/2 tsp. vanilla, 2 tsp. green food coloring, 4 c. corn flakes, red cinnamon candies. Here's the instruction: Melt margarine and marshmallows. Add vanilla and food coloring. Pour over corn flakes and stir until well coated. Shape into wreaths and add 2 or 3 candies for berries. Put on wax paper to cool.

input_text: I have . Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Pommes Dauphine - Puffed Potatoes  with Serves 6. Here's the instruction: 1. Clean and boil the potatoes in slightly salted water until soft (about 20 minutes) 2. Allow them to cool slightly, then peel them, and mash them as if making mashed potatoes. 3. Return them to a very low heat and dry the mashed potatoes stirring with a wooden spoon until they no longer stick to the sides of the pot. 4. While the potatoes are boiling, make the dough: boil 8 oz (25cl) of water with the butter and a pinch of salt, remove from heat and add the flour all at once mixing vigorously until absorbed, then put the mixture back on a low fire to dry slightly. 5. Remove the mixture from the fire and add the eggs, one at a time, and mix until you have a dough that is still wet and slightly sticky. 3. Mix the potatoes and the dough together completely in the ratio of 1/3 potato with 2/3 dough. Add salt, nutmeg and pepper to taste. 4. Heat several inches of oil in a pot or deep fryer to 350F (180C) and carefully drop a tablespoon of the mixture into the the oil - repeating until you are cooking 5-6 at a time. 5. Allow the mixture to puff up and brown before removing it to drain on paper towels. 6. Repeat until the mixture is gone. Serve hot. These are a fabulous accompaniment to meat dishes and chicken. As a variation add some grated cheese to the mixture before cooking.

input_text: I have tomatoes, mayonnaise, iceberg lettuce, beef schnitzel, hamburger. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Chuck Wagon Sandwich with 1 (3 -4 ounce) pre-cooked breaded beef schnitzel, 1 large hamburger bun, 2 slices ripe tomatoes, 2 pieces iceberg lettuce, 1 tablespoon mayonnaise. Here's the instruction: Heat beef patty by pan frying in shallow oil or baking in oven at 350F 10-12 minutes or until crispy, whichever is directed for your patty or whichever you prefer. Assemble ingredients on warmed or toasted bun and serve with chips, fries, onion rings, etc.

input_text: I have sugar, soy sauce, flank steak, asian sesame oil, garlic, olive oil. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Soy-Marinated Flank Steak with 1/4 cup low-sodium soy sauce, 3 tablespoons olive oil, 1 tablespoon sugar, 1 garlic clove, minced, 1 teaspoon Asian sesame oil, One 1 1/2 to 2 pound flank steak. Here's the instruction: In a small bowl, combine the soy with 2 tablespoons of the olive oil, sugar, garlic and sesame oil. Transfer the marinade to a zippered plastic bag and add the flank steak, turning to coat. Seal the bag and marinate at room temperature for 1 hour or in the refrigerator for up to 8 hours. Preheat a grill or grill pan. Remove the steak from the marinade and pat dry. Rub both sides with 1 tablespoon of the oil and grill over high heat for 4 to 5 minutes per side for medium-rare meat at the thickest part. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest 5 minutes. Thinly slice the meat against the grain and serve.

input_text: I have egg, almond, vanilla, baking powder, peppermint, flour, margarine, icing sugar, food coloring, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Candy Cane Cookies with 1 cup margarine, 1 cup icing sugar, 1 egg, 1 teaspoon almond extract, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1 teaspoon peppermint extract (You can use mix of mint/peppermint extract; I've used it on occasion and it tastes great!), 2 12 cups flour, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 1 teaspoon salt, food coloring. Here's the instruction: Mix first six ingredients together, beating well. Add flour, baking powder and salt. Mix well. Divide dough in two portions. Add colour to one portion. Blend well. Take a bit of dough from coloured and from not coloured. Squish together so it blends a bit together (think candy cane). Roll into snake like shape and either make into wreath or into candy cane. Bake in oven- 300 degrees F for about 8 minutes or until lightly browned.

input_text: I have hawaiian punch, pineapple juice, apple juice, orange juice. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Fruit Punch with 1 frozen can orange juice, 1 frozen can apple juice, 1 (46 oz.) can pineapple juice, 1 (46 oz.) can Hawaiian Punch. Here's the instruction: Dilute apple juice as directed. Add orange juice; stir well. Add pineapple juice; stir well. Add Hawaiian Punch; mix well.

input_text: I have bread, apples pared, chicken broth, onions, sausage, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Sausage and Apple Casserole with 8 cups bread cubed (about 15 slices cubed in 1/2" cubes), 1 pound sausage bulk, 1 each onions diced, 2 cups chicken broth, 2 each apples pared, cored, chopped into 1/2 inch or smaller pieces, 1 teaspoon salt. Here's the instruction: Dry bread cubes in 250 degree oven for 10 minutes. Brown sausage in small amount of water in skillet; drain. Add onion, cook 2 minutes. Stir in bread cubes, chicken broth, apples and salt. Combine thoroughly. Pour into well greased casserole dish and bake in 300 degree oven for 30 minutes or until top crusts. Note: This is great with scrambled or fried eggs. Terrific as a meal or for breakfast.

input_text: I have sugar, bittersweet chocolate, salt, vanilla, baking soda, eggs, flour, unsalted butter. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Double Chocolate Brownies with 8 ounces bittersweet chocolate (70% cacao), 1 cup unsalted butter (2 sticks), 1 12 cups granulated sugar, 1 14 cups all-purpose flour, 12 teaspoon baking soda, 14 teaspoon salt, 4 large eggs, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, 2 teaspoons confectioners' sugar. Here's the instruction: Heat oven to 350. Line a 9" square baking pan with nonstick foil; set aside. Reserve 2 oz of the chocolate. Chop remaining 6 oz and place in a large microwave-safe bowl with butter. Microwave for 1 minute. Stir. Microwave for 30 seconds. Stir until smooth. Stir sugar, flour, baking soda and salt into chocolate mixture until well blended. Add eggs and vanilla; stir until smooth. Chop remaining 2 oz chocolate and stir into batter. Pour into prepared pan, spreading level. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until toothpick come out clean when inserted in center. Cool on rack for 10 minutes. Lift brownie from pan using foil; place directly on rack to cool completely. Dust with confectioners' sugar.

input_text: I have sugar, vanilla, flour, margarine, potato chips, chocolate kisses. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Potato Chip Cookies with 4 sticks Imperial margarine, 1 c. sugar, 3 c. flour, 3 tsp. vanilla, 2 c. crushed potato chips, chocolate kisses or M&M's (optional). Here's the instruction: Combine all ingredients together (except optionals) and mix well. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet and flatten with spatula. Bake at 350° for 12 to 15 minutes. After baking, while cookie is still warm, you can top with a chocolate kiss or an M&M.

input_text: I have sugar, vanilla, pecans, egg whites, water, light karo. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Divinity with 2 2/3 c. sugar, 2/3 c. light Karo, 1/2 c. water (1 tsp. less if humid day), 2 egg whites, 1 tsp. vanilla, 2/3 c. chopped pecans. Here's the instruction: Combine sugar, Karo and water in pan. Stir and bring to boil. Let boil approximately 10 minutes or until small amount dropped into very cold water forms a hard ball.

input_text: I have buttermilk, bacon, sugar, baking soda, eggs, cornmeal. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Nana'S Cornbread with 2 tablespoons bacon drippings, 2 cups self-rising yellow cornmeal, 1 teaspoon sugar, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 2 large eggs, 1 1/2 cups buttermilk, well shaken. Here's the instruction: Preheat oven to 400°. Pour bacon drippings into a 10-inch cast-iron skillet, and place in oven. Combine cornmeal, sugar, and baking soda in a large bowl. Mix eggs and buttermilk in a separate bowl, stirring well. Add buttermilk mixture to dry ingredients. Add 1 tablespoon hot bacon drippings, and stir just until moistened. Swirl remaining 1 tablespoon bacon drippings around skillet to coat evenly; pour batter into hot skillet. Bake at 400° for 25 to 30 minutes or until golden brown. Invert onto a cooling rack to cool slightly. Cut into wedges, and serve warm.

input_text: I have ground red pepper, green bell pepper, sesame, soy sauce, green onions, ramen noodles, cornstarch, chicken broth, red bell pepper, ground ginger, shrimp, garlic. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Stir-Fry Shrimp with 1 pound unpeeled, medium-size fresh shrimp, 3 tablespoons cornstarch, divided, 1 garlic clove, pressed, 1/4 teaspoon ground red pepper, 3 tablespoons soy sauce, divided, 3 tablespoons sesame or vegetable oil, divided, 1 (14 1/2-ounce) can chicken broth, 1/2 teaspoon ground ginger, 1 red bell pepper, cut into thin strips, 1 green bell pepper, cut into thin strips, 1 bunch green onions, cut into 1/2-inch slices, Hot cooked ramen noodles or angel hair pasta. Here's the instruction: Peel shrimp, and devein, if desired. Combine shrimp, 1 tablespoon cornstarch, garlic, red pepper, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, and 1 tablespoon oil; let stand 5 minutes. Whisk together remaining 2 tablespoons cornstarch, remaining 2 tablespoons soy sauce, chicken broth, and ginger; set aside. Heat remaining 2 tablespoons oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat 2 minutes. Add bell pepper strips, and stir-fry 4 minutes or until tender. Add green onions; stir-fry 2 minutes. Remove from skillet. Add shrimp mixture to skillet; stir-fry 3 minutes. Reduce heat to low; add vegetables and chicken broth mixture, and stir-fry 3 minutes or until thickened and bubbly. Serve over hot cooked noodles.

input_text: I have chicken breasts, lemon juice, cranberries, mushrooms, heavy whipping cream, port wine, onions, parsley, bread crumbs, tarragon, chicken broth, red wine, butter, zucchini. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Roasted Chicken Breasts with Cranberry Port Sauce with 12 each chicken breasts boneless, 2 tablespoons butter, 1 medium onions chopped, 1 pound mushrooms chopped, 3 each zucchini grated and drained, 1 teaspoon tarragon leaves, 1/2 cup heavy whipping cream, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, 1/4 cup bread crumbs, 1/4 cup parsley leaves chopped, 1/2 cup port wine, 1 cup red wine, 2 tablespoons butter, 1/2 cup cranberries, dried, 2 cups chicken broth. Here's the instruction: To buy boneless chicken breasts with the skin on, purchase chicken breasts on the bone and ask your butcher or supermarket to remove the bones but leave the skin intact. It is a much more beautiful presentation and it keeps the chicken moist. Bones can be used to make stock or discarded. If you prefer, or can only obtain skinless chicken, then make a cut on the bottom of each breast the length of the breast to form a pocket. Stuff each breast with same amount of filling and turn slit side down. Brush top with a film of Dijon mustard and continue with recipe. To heighten mushroom flavour, add one package of soaked dried mushrooms along with the regular mushrooms, if desired. Dried currents may be substituted for cranberries. Trim chicken breasts of any fat. Heat butter in skillet on medium high heat. Add onion, saute until softened the add mushrooms and zucchini. Saute until all liquid has evaporated, stirring occasionally, about 10 minutes. Stir in tarragon and cream. Continue to cook until cream has reduced and mixture is thick, about 5 minutes. Stir in lemon juice and add enough breadcrumbs to hold mixture together. Add parsely and season well with salt and pepper. Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper. With fingertips, make a pocket between skin and flesh of each chicken breast. Stuff about 13 cup filling under skin, tucking skin around breast to enclose stuffing. Place chicken breasts in large oiled (preferably metal) baking dish or roasting pan. Dot with butter, refrigerate until one hour before baking. Baking in 400F (200C) oven for 30 to 40 minutes or until juices run clear. If skin is not quite crisp enough, place under broiler to crisp it. While chicken is baking, place sauce ingredients in pot and bring to boil over medium high heat. Reduce by half, skimming occasionally, about 25 minutes. Over low heat, whisk in butter, 1 tablespoon at a time, until sauce is slightly thickened and glossy. Just before serving, skim any fat off pan juices and add juices to sauce. Either slice chicken breasts into 1/4 inch slices before serving and coat with sauce or serve chicken breasts whole and place sauce in sauce boat. Garnish with extra dried cranberries, if desired.

input_text: I have green chilies, velveeta, brand chili, green onions. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Oklahoma Prairie Fire(Serves 6)   with 1 (15 oz.) can Wolf brand chili (no beans), 1 (4 oz.) can chopped green chilies, 1 bunch green onions, chopped, 1 lb. Velveeta, sliced. Here's the instruction: Mix first three ingredients in 1 1/2-quart casserole. Top with sliced cheese. Bake at 275° for 30 to 40 minutes. Serve in chafing dish, fondue pot or on warming tray with Doritos.

input_text: I have bacon, tomatoes, onion, flour, green beans, green pepper, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make *Spanish Green Beans with 2 strips bacon, chopped, 1/4 c. onion, chopped, 2 Tbsp. green pepper, chopped, 1 Tbsp. flour, 2 c. tomatoes, drained (if canned), 1 c. green beans, drained, salt and pepper to taste. Here's the instruction: Fry bacon, onion and green pepper in heavy skillet until bacon is crisp and onion and pepper are brown. Add flour. Stir and add tomatoes, green beans and salt and pepper to taste. Place in a casserole dish and bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

input_text: I have endive, black peppercorns, pecan, char fillet, brown sugar, thyme, bay leaves, dill, apples, kosher salt, white wine vinegar, juniper berries, garlic, mustard, honey, grapeseed oil, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Arctic Char Gravlax with Apple-Pecan Salad with 3 cups kosher salt, 1 1/4 cups packed light brown sugar, 1/2 cup chopped fresh dill, 3 tablespoons juniper berries, crushed, 2 bay leaves, 2 tablespoons black peppercorns, One 1-pound arctic char fillet, skin on, 1 cup pecan halves (4 ounces), 2 tablespoons Champagne or white wine vinegar, 1 tablespoon honey, 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard, 1/4 cup grapeseed oil, 1 small garlic clove, minced, 1 1/2 teaspoons finely chopped thyme, Sea salt and freshly ground pepper, 2 Granny Smith apples, cut into matchsticks, 1 large Belgian endive, halved, cored and thinly sliced crosswise. Here's the instruction: In a bowl, mix the salt with the brown sugar, dill and juniper berries. In a spice grinder, grind the bay leaves with the peppercorns. Add to the salt cure and mix well. Spread half of the salt in a deep plate. Add the fish fillet, skin side down, and cover with the remaining salt. Cover with plastic and refrigerate for 24 hours. Remove the fish from the salt and soak it in ice water in the refrigerator for 3 hours. Pat dry. Transfer the fish, skin side down, to a rack set on a baking sheet. Refrigerate, uncovered, overnight. Preheat the oven to 350. Spread the pecans in a pie plate and toast for 7 minutes, or until fragrant. Let cool. In a large bowl, whisk the vinegar with the honey and mustard. Add the oil and whisk until blended. Whisk in the garlic and thyme and season with sea salt and pepper. Add the apples and endive and toss, then add the pecans and toss again. Using a thin, sharp knife, thinly slice the gravlax on the diagonal off the skin. Mound the salad on plates, surround it with gravlax and serve.

input_text: I have orange zest, fresh fruit, marshmallow creme, cream cheese, ground ginger. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Orange-Ginger Fruit Dip with 1 package (8 ounces) cream cheese, softened, 1 jar (7 ounces) marshmallow creme, 1 tablespoon grated orange zest, 1/8 teaspoon ground ginger, Assorted fresh fruit. Here's the instruction: In a small bowl, beat cream cheese until smooth. Beat in the marshmallow creme, orange zest and ginger. Cover and refrigerate until serving. Serve with fruit.

input_text: I have oil, salt, fresh spinach, onion, water, fresh gingerroot, dill, orange juice, garlic, yams. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Spinach Orange Yam Soup with 2 tablespoons oil, 1 medium onion, finely chopped, 2 medium yams, thinly sliced, 5 garlic cloves, finely chopped, 1 tablespoon fresh gingerroot, grated, 1 tablespoon sea salt, 14 teaspoon dried dill weed, 3 cups water, 1 bunch fresh spinach, 13 cup orange juice, freshly squeezed. Here's the instruction: In a medium pot, fry the onion, yams, garlic and gingerroot in the oil on medium-low heat. Stir the ingredients so that they do not stick to the bottom of the pot. When the onions become translucent, stir in the salt, dill and water. Bring to boil, then reduce to a simmer and cover for about 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Blend this mixture on high until a creamy and smooth consistency is reached. You may need to do this in two, depending on the size of your blender. Pour all of the blended soup back into the pot. Add the spinach and orange juice, and cover the soup, allowing the spinach to wilt in the steam. Serve immediately.

input_text: I have sugar, vanilla, eggs, cinnamon, sweet potatoes, allspice, butter. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Sweet Potato Pie with 2 large sweet potatoes, 2 c. sugar, 1 1/2 sticks Land 'O Lakes butter, 1 tsp. cinnamon, 1/2 tsp. allspice, 2 eggs, 1 tsp. vanilla. Here's the instruction: Mix sugar and butter. Add sweet potatoes, then butter; add cinnamon, allspice and eggs all together and then add vanilla flavor. Bake at 350° for 40 minutes.

input_text: I have vanilla, chocolate shoppe, granulated sugar, brown sugar, kisses, flour, margarine, chocolate chips. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Chocolate Chip Kiss Cookies with 1 (14 oz.) bag Hershey's Kisses with almonds, 2 c. softened margarine, 2/3 c. brown sugar, 2/3 c. granulated sugar, 2 tsp. vanilla, 4 c. flour, 2 c. mini chocolate chips, Hershey's Chocolate Shoppe Topping (optional). Here's the instruction: Remove foil from Kisses. In a large bowl, combine butter, sugars and vanilla. Beat well. Add flour; blend until smooth. Stir in chips. Mold scant tablespoon of dough around each Kiss, covering completely. Shape into ball and place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until set. Cool. Remove from cookie sheet. Makes 6 to 7 dozen cookies. Drizzle topping over each cookie (optional).

input_text: I have egg, baking powder, vanilla, caramels, brown sugar, topping, water, flour, nuts, semi-sweet chocolate chips, butter, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Blonde Brownie Caramel Cups with Cups, 1/2 cup butter or 1/2 cup margarine, 1 cup brown sugar, firmly packed, 1 teaspoon vanilla, 1 egg, 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/2 cup chopped nuts, Topping, 20 caramels, unwrapped, 1 tablespoon water, 1/2 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips, 1/4 - 1/2 cup finely chopped nuts. Here's the instruction: Heat oven to 350°F. Line 16 muffin cups with foil or paper baking cups. Melt butter in medium saucepan over low heat. Remove from heat and stir in brown sugar. Add vanilla and egg; mix well. Add flour, baking powder and salt; blend well. Stir in 1/2 cup chopped nuts. Divide batter evenly into lined muffin cups. Bake for 16 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Meanwhile, in small saucepan over low heat, melt caramels with water; stir constantly until smooth (or microwave in glass bowl with 1 tablespoon water on High for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally). Immediately after brownie cups are removed from oven, place chocolate chips evenly into middle of each brownie. Spoon 1 scant tablespoon of caramel over chocolate chips in each cup. If necessary, stir additional water into melted caramels to maintain spoonable consistency. Sprinkle 1/4 cup finly chopped nuts evenly over brownies. Cool completely. Store in tightly covered container.

input_text: I have swiss cheese, snack rye bread, cream cheese, salad dressing, beef, sauerkraut. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Slow-Cooked Reuben Spread with 2 packages (8 ounces each) cream cheese, cubed, 4 cups shredded Swiss cheese, 1 can (14 ounces) sauerkraut, rinsed and well drained, 4 packages (2 ounces each) thinly sliced deli corned beef, chopped, 1/2 cup Thousand Island salad dressing, Snack rye bread or rye crackers. Here's the instruction: Place the first five ingredients in a 1-1/2-qt. slow cooker; stir to combine. Cook, covered, on low 4 to 4-1/2 hours or until heated through. Stir to blend. Serve spread with bread.

input_text: I have tomato, sour cream, onion, worstershire sauce, mushrooms, egg noodles, water, beef bouillon, butter. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Beef Stroganoff with 1 onion, 1 1/2 lb rib eye steak, 1 box mushrooms, 16 oz sour cream, 1 small tomato paste, 2 tbsp worstershire sauce, 1 tbsp butter, 1 tsp beef bouillon, 1 packages egg noodles, 1/2 cup water. Here's the instruction: Add butter. Saute onion, brown meat, throw in mushrooms, cook a few minutes, add all other ingredients and bring to boil then simmer 15 minutes. Pour over egg noodles

input_text: I have bacon, tomatoes, bell pepper, salt, onion, celery, black-eyed peas, white wine vinegar, ro-tel tomatoes. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Spicy Black-Eyed Peas with 3 cans black-eyed peas, 2 c. chopped onion, 2 c. chopped celery, 2 c. chopped bell pepper, 3 chopped and seeded tomatoes, 1/2 lb. bacon, fried and crumbled, 1 Tbsp. white wine vinegar, 1 can Ro-Tel tomatoes, salt and pepper to taste. Here's the instruction: Mix and cook all ingredients together in a large kettle. Goes good with Mexican corn bread.

input_text: I have egg, pepper, onion, beef, olive oil, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Gluten Free Meatballs with minced beef 2 pounds ground, 1 egg, 1 onion finely chopped, salt, pepper, olive oil. Here's the instruction: Mix all of the ingredients in a bowl Make meatball sized balls out of the mix (it should hold together well. Add g-free breadcrumbs if too sticky) Fry in olive oil Serve with or without tomato sauce. (we ate one batch with baked rosemary potatoes and another on polenta with tomato sauce)

input_text: I have bread, sugar, vanilla, eggs, lemon zest, coloring, water, cornstarch, freshly squeezed lemon juice, milk, baking pan, butter, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Bread Pudding with Lemon Sauce with 3 slices (about 2 cups/500 mL) day-old bread, crusts removed, cut into cubes, 2 cups (500 mL) milk, 1/4 cup (50 mL) granulated sugar, 3 tbsp (45 mL) butter, Pinch salt, 2 eggs, 1/2 tsp (2 mL) vanilla, 1/2 cup (125 mL) granulated sugar, 1 tbsp (15 mL) cornstarch, Pinch salt, 1 cup (250 mL) water, 1 to 2 tsp (5 to 10 mL) grated lemon zest, 2 tbsp (25 mL) butter, 1 tbsp (15 mL) freshly squeezed lemon juice, 1 to 2 drops yellow food coloring (optional), 6-cup (1.5 L) casserole dish, greased, 13- by 9-inch (3 L) baking pan. Here's the instruction: Preheat oven to 350F (180C). Spoon the bread cubes into prepared casserole dish. Set aside. In a saucepan, over low heat, heat milk, sugar, butter and salt just until butter has melted. In a bowl, whisk eggs and vanilla. Whisk in the heated milk mixture until well blended. Spoon over bread cubes. Place in baking pan set on oven rack and pour in water to a depth of 1 inch (5 cm). Bake, uncovered, in preheated oven for 40 to 50 minutes or until a knife inserted near the edge of the pan comes out clean and dry. Let cool on a wire rack. Prepare the lemon sauce: In a medium saucepan, over medium heat, combine sugar, cornstarch and salt and mix to blend. Stir in water and zest and bring to a boil, cooking and stirring for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and add butter, lemon juice and food coloring (if using). Stir until well blended. Serve warm or cold over pudding.

input_text: I have egg, crisco, all-purpose, water, white vinegar, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Easy Pie Crust with 3 c. all-purpose flour, 1 tsp. salt, 5 Tbsp. water, 1 1/4 c. Crisco, 1 egg, well beaten, 1 tsp. white vinegar. Here's the instruction: Mix together. Divide into balls and roll into pie crusts. Can be frozen.

input_text: I have sugar, shortening, cheddar cheese, water, flour, yeast, milk, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Cheese Bread with 1 pkg. yeast, 1/4 c. lukewarm water, 1 c. milk, 1 Tbsp. shortening, 2 Tbsp. sugar, 2 tsp. salt, 2 c. sifted flour, 1/2 lb. wedge Cheddar cheese, 1 c. lukewarm water, about 4 c. flour. Here's the instruction: Sprinkle yeast on 1/4 cup water; let stand 5 minutes. Scald milk and shortening. Add sugar and salt; cool. Add 2 cups flour. Beat smooth. Grate cheese on dough. Stir yeast. Add with 1 cup lukewarm water. Mix well. Add 4 cups flour all at once. Beat smooth. Make medium soft dough. Knead until smooth. Place in bowl. Let rise until double. Shape into 2 loaves. Bake at 400° for 40 minutes.

input_text: I have cream of chicken soup, cream of mushroom soup, cream of celery soup, chicken broth, herb seasoned stuffing mix, chicken. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Crunchy Chicken Casserole with 1 can cream of mushroom soup, 1 can cream of celery soup, 1 can cream of chicken soup, 1 1/2 c. chicken broth, 1 (8 oz.) pkg. herb seasoned stuffing mix, 3 c. chopped, cooked chicken. Here's the instruction: Blend soups and broth in bowl. Layer 3/4 of the stuffing mix and chicken in 2-quart casserole. Pour soup over chicken. Top with remaining stuffing mix. Bake at 350° for 25 minutes (uncovered). Yields 8 servings.

input_text: I have basmati rice, cinnamon, button mushrooms, cloves, cardamom pods, vegetable stock, lemon, onions, garlic, butter. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Spinach, Mushroom & Lemon Pilaf with 2 onions, finely sliced, 2 garlic cloves, crushed, 50 g butter, 150 g button mushrooms, sliced, 1 cinnamon stick, 4 whole cloves, 4 cardamom pods, bruised, 250 g basmati rice, 12 zest and lemon, juice of, 450 ml vegetable stock, 200 g spinach, washed and roughly chopped. Here's the instruction: Cook the onions and garlic in the butter in a large shallow pan until soft and golden. Add the button mushrooms and cook until soft. Add the spices and cook for 2 minutes, then stir in the rice, lemon zest and stock. Cover. Cook on a gentle heat for about 15 minutes until the liquid has been absorbed. Stir through the spinach and lemon juice, cover for 2 minutes until wilted and serve.

input_text: I have egg, black pepper, green onions, canola mayonnaise, canola oil, water, cooking spray, dill pickle, cornstarch, tilapia, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Fish Nuggets With Crispy Asparagus "Fries" with 1 pound tilapia fillets, 3/8 teaspoon salt, divided, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, 1/3 cup cornstarch, 1 tablespoon water, 1 large egg, 1 cup whole-wheat panko (Japanese breadcrumbs), Cooking spray, 2 tablespoons canola oil, 1 pound asparagus, trimmed, 1/4 cup canola mayonnaise (such as Hellmann's), 1 tablespoon dill pickle relish, 1 tablespoon finely chopped green onions. Here's the instruction: Preheat oven to 450°. Place a large jelly-roll pan in oven (leave pan in oven as it preheats). Cut fish into 1 1/2-inch pieces; sprinkle evenly with 1/4 teaspoon salt and pepper. Place cornstarch in a shallow dish (such as a pie plate). Combine 1 tablespoon water and egg in a shallow bowl; stir with a fork. Place panko in a shallow dish. Dredge fish in cornstarch; shake off excess. Dip fish in egg mixture. Dredge in panko. Carefully remove pan from oven; coat with cooking spray. Drizzle oil over pan; tilt pan to coat with oil. Arrange asparagus on one side of pan and fish on the other. Sprinkle asparagus with 1/8 teaspoon salt. Bake at 450° for 12 minutes or until done, turning fish and stirring asparagus after 8 minutes. Combine mayonnaise, relish, and onions. Arrange 3 ounces fish, 1/4 of asparagus, and 1 tablespoon sauce on each of 4 plates.

input_text: I have oleo, flour, paprika, chicken, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Oven Fried Chicken with 1 chicken, quartered, washed and dried, 1 c. flour, 2 tsp. paprika, salt and pepper to taste, 1/4 c. oleo. Here's the instruction: Heat oven to 425°. Shake the chicken in a mixture of the flour, paprika, salt and pepper. Melt the oleo in a 13 x 9-inch pan. Assemble chicken, skin side down. Bake for 45 minutes. Turn; bake an additional 15 minutes.

input_text: I have orange jello, mandarin oranges, pineapple, cottage cheese. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Jello-Cottage Cheese Salad with 1 (3 oz.) orange jello, 12 oz. cottage cheese (small curd), 1 small can mandarin oranges, 1 small can crushed pineapple, 4 1/2 oz. Cool Whip. Here's the instruction: Mix dry jello into small curd cottage cheese. Drain mandarin oranges and pineapple. Add both fruits and small container of Cool Whip into cottage cheese. Chill.

input_text: I have sugar, vanilla, heavy cream, eggs, flour, pie crust, fruit. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Quick Fruit Cream Pie with 9-inch pie crust, 3 c. fruit, 1 c. sugar, 1/2 c. flour, 1 c. heavy cream, 1 tsp. vanilla, 2 eggs. Here's the instruction: Prepare fruit and put in pie shell. In bowl, beat eggs lightly and blend in sugar, flour, cream and vanilla. Pour over fruit. Bake at 375° for 1 hour or until knife inserted in center comes out clean.

input_text: I have sour cream, graham cracker crust, sugar, vanilla, eggs, cream cheese, almond extract, cherry pie filling. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Cheese Cake with 2 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese, 1 c. sugar, 3 eggs, 3 c. sour cream, 2 tsp. vanilla, 1/2 tsp. almond extract, graham cracker crust (according to pkg.), 1 can blueberry or cherry pie filling. Here's the instruction: Prepare graham cracker crust according to package. Press in bottom of spring-form pan (9-inch).

input_text: I have philadelphia cream cheese, crackers, strawberry preserves, almonds. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Fruit & Nut Bites with 2 RITZ Crackers, 2 tsp. PHILADELPHIA Cream Cheese Spread, 1 tsp. strawberry preserves, 1 tsp. toasted PLANTERS Sliced Almonds. Here's the instruction: Spread crackers with cream cheese spread; top with preserves. Sprinkle with almonds.

input_text: I have cabbage, red sweet peppers, sugar, vinegar, water, green sweet peppers, celery, onions, turmeric, hot pepper. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Sweet Pepper Relish with 12 medium onions, chopped, 2 green sweet peppers, chopped, 6 red sweet peppers, chopped, 1 large cabbage, chopped, 1 hot pepper, chopped, 6 c. sugar, 2 Tbsp. mustard seed, 1 Tbsp. celery seed, 1 1/2 Tbsp. turmeric, 4 c. vinegar, 2 c. water. Here's the instruction: Bring to a boil; simmer for 15 minutes. Can and seal. Have your jars and lids good and hot.

input_text: I have dr. oetker, ginger, green cardamom pods, cinnamon, milk. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Easy Chai Creme Caramel (Aka Chai Flan De Leche) with 2 (105 g) packages Dr. Oetker caramel creme dessert mix (Dr. Oetker is vegetarian), 400 ml milk, 1 cinnamon stick, broken into several pieces, 4 whole green cardamom pods, 2 slices fresh ginger or 2 slices candied ginger. Here's the instruction: Divide caramel sauce equally into ramekins, one for each serving. Make sure a thin coat of caramel covers the bottom of each ramekin. Set these aside. Dissolve contents of custard mix into 125mL of milk and whisk until blended. Put remaining milk and whole spices in a saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat slightly and add custard mixture, whisking vigorously. Bring just to a boil again, and keep stirring so no lumps form. The allow to simmer for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Skim spices out of liquid. (Or pour mixture through small mesh strainer in the next step.). Gently pour liquid into ramekins, making sure not to disturb the caramel coating the base of each one. Chill ramekins until set. (This takes approximately 45 minutes in my refridgerator.) Remove ramekins from refridgerator. Put a serving plate against top of a ramekin, , hold them together, and flip them upside down in a fast motion so the creme caramel flops out of the ramekin and onto the serving plate. Let it sit for a minute to allow the caramel to run over the custard before removing ramekin. Repeat this for each serving. (This is quite easy and the result looks impressive.). Enjoy!

input_text: I have orange zest, baking powder, sugar, lemon juice, lemon zest, egg whites, flour, orange juice, cream of tartar, white sugar, butter, egg yolks, flaked coconut, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make General Robert E. Lee Cake II with 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1/2 teaspoon cream of tartar, 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder, 8 egg yolks, 2 cups white sugar, 8 egg whites, 2 teaspoons grated lemon zest, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, 1/8 teaspoon salt, 4 egg yolks, 1 1/3 cups white sugar, 2 1/2 teaspoons grated lemon zest, 1/3 cup lemon juice, 1/4 cup butter, 1/3 cup butter, softened, 4 cups confectioners' sugar, 3 tablespoons grated orange zest, 2 1/2 tablespoons orange juice, 1 1/2 teaspoons grated lemon zest, 1 1/2 tablespoons lemon juice, 1/2 cup flaked coconut. Here's the instruction: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease and flour two 9 inch pans. Sift together the flour, baking powder, and cream of tartar. Set aside. In a medium bowl, beat together the 8 egg yolks and 2 cups sugar until thick and pale. Stir in the 2 teaspoons lemon zest and 2 tablespoons lemon juice. In a large glass or metal mixing bowl, beat egg whites and salt until soft peaks form. Fold whites into the egg yolk mixture alternately with the flour mixture. Spread evenly into the prepared pans. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the cake comes out clean. Let layers cool in the pan for 15 minutes before inverting onto wire racks to cool completely. Using a long serrated knife, slice the layers in half horizontally. To make the filling: In the top of a double boiler, combine the 1 1/3 cup sugar, 4 egg yolks, 2 1/2 teaspoon lemon zest and 1/3 cup lemon juice. Cook over high heat, stirring constantly, until the sugar is dissolved and mixture thickens. Remove from heat, and stir in the butter. Cool to room temperature before filling cake. To make the frosting: In a medium bowl, cream the 1/3 cup butter until light and fluffy. Gradually add the confectioners sugar and mix in the orange zest, orange juice, lemon zest and lemon juice. Finally, stir in coconut. Frost the outside of the filled cake.

input_text: I have sugar, powdered sugar, low sugar, milk, cupcakes. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Butterfly Cupcakes with 6 tsp. low sugar jam (strawberry or raspberry), 1 doz. cupcakes, 1 box sugar-free instant vanilla pudding mix, 2 c. skim milk, powdered sugar (optional). Here's the instruction: Make pudding according to package directions, using skim milk. Let sit for 5 minutes. Cut a cone shape from the top of each cupcake and set aside. Fil the cavity of each cupcake with 1 tablespoon of pudding. Cut cones in half and place two halves, flat side down, on each cupcake to represent butterfly wings. Place 1/2 teaspoon of jam in the center to resemble the body. Dust with powdered sugar. Chocolate fans can substitute chocolate cupcakes and fill with whipped topping.

input_text: I have sugar, water, cold water, pineapple juice, ginger ale, o, pineapple. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Party Punch with 1 (6 oz.) pkg. Jell-O (any flavor), 2 c. hot water, 2 c. cold water, 1 large can pineapple juice, 2 c. sugar, 1 small can crushed pineapple, 2 qt. ginger ale. Here's the instruction: Mix all ingredients except ginger ale and put in a freezer overnight. Take it out about 15 minutes before serving time. Chop with food chopper and add ginger ale.

input_text: I have fresh breadcrumb, emmenthaler cheese, cheddar cheese, parmesan cheese, onion, white pepper, flour, milk, elbow macaroni, mustard, butter, salt. Give me some cooking ideas.
target_text: You can make Macaroni And Cheese..... Please with 2 cups elbow macaroni, 1 small onion, minced, 2 tablespoons butter, 1 tablespoon flour, 3/4 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon dry mustard, 1/8 teaspoon white pepper, 2 cups milk, 6 ounces good strong cheddar cheese, shredded, 3 ounces emmenthaler cheese, shredded, 2 tablespoons freshly grated parmesan cheese, 3/4 cup fresh breadcrumb, 1 1/2 tablespoons butter. Here's the instruction: Preheat oven to 400°F/200°C Prepare macaroni as directed on the package. Drain well, rinse and set aside. Place 2 TBS butter and the onion in a small saucepan . Cook over medium heat until tender, but not browned. Stir in the flour, salt, mustard and pepper. Cook 1 minute. Slowly stir in the milk and cook, stirring until smooth. Mix the cheeses together. Add about 3/4 of the cheese, stirring until the cheese is melted. Taste and adjust seasonings as desired. Put the cooked macaroni into a greased 1 1/2 litre casserole.
